title: Maximum Overdrive
review: You have to sit through 20 minutes of random bullshit before any of the premise is explained, only to find that the premise is that a bunch of wacky strangers are going to encounter more random bullshit. It's a short story turned into a 90 minute film, and it shows. Steven King said he was "coked out of mind" and "didn't know what he was doing" while directing this, and it shows. The soundtrack is good and it fits well, helping the film verge on so-bad-it's-good status. He was also drunk.
